meanings.definition: To predict (something) to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overpredict the number of goals her favorite team will score.
meanings.sent2: He always overpredicts how long it will take to finish a project.
meanings.sent3: Don't overpredict the amount of ice cream you can eat in one sitting!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overpredicts the actual turnout for the event.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast tends to overpredict snowfall amounts in our area.

meanings.definition: To make a prediction that is too high or optimistic.
meanings.sent1: The sales team tends to overpredict their quarterly earnings.
meanings.sent2: It is common for people to overpredict their chances of winning the lottery.
meanings.sent3: I always overpredict how many likes my social media posts will get.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence in the team's success overpredicts their actual performance.
meanings.sent5: The student tends to overpredict his grades before receiving his exam results.
